title: Introduction to Your I Am Market-Ready Page
Properties:
The I Am Market-Ready Page allows you to assess your own development through the lens of the Learn to Start criteria. The Five Pillars are the assessment categories that you will use to prove the results of your empowerment, wellness, and performance journey over the course of your time in the program. You will gather and provide context that demonstrates your development and ability in each of the categories. You will then submit this page for initial assessment from your instructor and then for certification.

This process is meant to go alongside your participation in the program. It will take time, experience, and iteration to get you ready to submit to your instructor. Once you have submitted to your instructor, you will most likely receive feedback to help guide you towards additional development so as to ensure you are ready for certification.

Using the I Am Market Ready page, you will be able to create a compilation of content that speaks to your empowerment, wellness, and performance. You have the ability to add multiple forms of content and tag those components to specify which category they represent.

title: Gathering Your Content
Properties:
As you progress towards your goals and through your time in the program, you will gather content you have created to prove your development as someone who is empowered, has achieved wellness, and can perform in the market. You will tag each piece of content you provide on your I Am Market-Ready page with an empowerment, wellness, and/or performance tag. One piece of content can be tagged more than once. In order to create your page, you must have an understanding of each tag. There are ten categories that make up the Five Pillars and within each is a progression of three tags starting with empowerment, which sets the stage for wellness, and the combination allows you to perform. Each of the categories with their progressions of criteria can be found in the Market-Ready graphic.

Throughout your time in the program, you have been reflecting in your three journals: My LTS Journal, My Wellness Journal, and My Personal Finance Journal. These journal entries represent potential content for your I Am Market-Ready page especially in the areas of Empowerment and Performance. On the I Am Market-Ready Page, you will see that you have the capability of importing individual journal entries. You also have the capability of importing articles that you have published on the platform. Remember, this page will be seen by your instructor and then by The Startup Studio for certification. This will not be public-facing, but will hold some of the same content that you will put on your public-facing portfolio.

Here is a breakdown of the ten categories, along with specific guidance for each category to help you determine the most appropriate content to tag.

small.title: Story: Agency
small.Properties:
Empowerment: Define who you are in the market.

Tag a piece of evidence that demonstrates the story you are telling about who you are in the market. This evidence should show the elements of your story that communicate your value to the market. By making a claim as to who you are, you are defining the power of your story to your audience.

Wellness: Frame how story informs your identity.

Tag a piece of evidence that provides the context for how your story should be interpreted. This piece of evidence should show how you crafted your story to provide transparency into your professional identity. The way in which you tell your story informs the audience on how you define yourself.

Performance: Act on your story by making deliberate choices.

Tag a piece of market-ready evidence that resulted from pursuing your own story. Tag a piece of evidence in your portfolio that shows how your story impacted your actions. This is not you pointing to how you chose to tell your story, but rather, how your story motivated you to take an action to ready you for the market. You connect the dots for your audience.

small.title: Success: Empathy
small.Properties:
Empowerment: Define empathy and its place in your story.

Tag a piece of evidence that demonstrates your understanding and view on empathy. This piece of evidence should create the lens through which your audience views your level of empathy.

Wellness: Frame the problems, needs, and wants of others against your own.

Tag a piece of evidence that provides the context for your understanding of the problems, needs, and wants of others. This piece of evidence should show both self and social awareness.

Performance: Act with empathy by making choices considering the problems, needs, and wants of others.

Tag a piece of evidence that resulted from your consideration of the problems, needs, and/or wants of others.

small.title: Team: Collaboration
small.Properties:
Empowerment: Define what collaboration means to you and your style of collaboration.

Tag a piece of evidence that demonstrates your understanding of and approach to collaboration. This piece of evidence should speak to your style of collaboration.

Wellness: Frame your ability to work in a team based on knowing your role inside of it.

Tag a piece of evidence that provides the context for your role on a team. This piece of evidence should put the right expectations on you as a team member.

Performance: Act in collaboration with others by creating outcomes together.

Tag a piece of market-ready evidence that resulted from collaboration with others.

small.title: Team: Leadership
small.Properties:
Empowerment: Define what leadership means to you and your style of leadership.

Tag a piece of evidence that demonstrates your understanding of and approach to leadership. This piece of evidence should speak to your style of leadership.

Wellness: Frame your ability to lead on a team and recognize others’ leadership on a team.

Tag a piece of evidence that provides the context for your leadership role on a team. This piece of evidence should put the right expectations on you as a team member.

Performance: Act as a leader or in recognition of leadership by creating outcomes with your team.

Tag a piece of market-ready evidence that resulted from your leadership within a team.

small.title: Build: Critical Thinking
small.Properties:
Empowerment: Define the problem you seek to solve.

Tag a piece of evidence that demonstrates a problem worth solving for your market. This piece of evidence should speak to the problem you seek to solve so that your audience can understand how to view the problem.

Wellness: Frame your understanding of the problem in terms of the multiple approaches you could take in solving it

Tag a piece of evidence that provides the context for why and how you could solve this problem. This piece of evidence should prove you can iterate on your thinking around solving a problem.

Performance: Act on your understanding of the problem by making choices to solve the problem and iterate on your solution.

Tag a piece of market-ready evidence that resulted from creating a solution to your problem.

small.title: Build: Creativity
small.Properties:
Empowerment: Define the needs of the target market that the solution does not currently meet.

Tag a piece of evidence that demonstrates thinking beyond what is in existence and looking to what could be in existence. This piece of evidence should speak to your ability to pivot in the execution of a solution.

Wellness: Frame your understanding of the solution in terms of exploring unrelated avenues that could be applied to solving it.

Tag a piece of evidence that provides the context for your different approach to executing a solution.This piece of evidence should show the application of design thinking models to your solution.

Performance: Act on your new perspective by making a change to the solution that meets the needs of the target market.

Tag a piece of market-ready evidence that shows a new iteration of a solution.

small.title: Pivot: Failure
small.Properties:
Empowerment: Define the role of failure and its purpose in your journey.

Tag a piece of evidence that demonstrates the role failure plays in your journey. This piece of evidence should show your relationship with failure and your ability to embrace it.

Wellness: Frame your failure in terms of how it enabled you to develop grit.

Tag a piece of evidence that provides the context for seeing your failure points as paths towards your success. This evidence should point to growth outcomes that failure has created for you.

Performance: Act using the data from failure by making deliberate pivots.

Tag a piece of market-ready evidence that resulted from a pivot motivated by a failure experience.

small.title: Pivot: Use of Data
small.Properties:
Empowerment: Define the methods through which you access data.

Tag a piece of evidence that demonstrates your ability to access data.This piece of evidence should highlight specific ways in which you gain access to relevant data.

Wellness: Frame your understanding of data in terms of its relevance to you.

Tag a piece of evidence that provides the context for determining what data is relevant to you. This piece of evidence should define relevance for you so your audience is not making that determination on your behalf.

Performance: Act by making data-based choices.

Tag a piece of market-ready evidence that resulted from the influence of data.

small.title: Pitch: Your Value
small.Properties:
Empowerment: Define your value in terms of the market that needs to value it.

Tag a piece of evidence that demonstrates that you have communicated your value to your intended market. This piece of evidence should differentiate you from others and offer a glimpse into your unique identity as a professional.

Wellness: Frame how your value fits into the world of your target market and communicate it to your market.

Tag a piece of evidence that provides the context for understanding the worth your market gets from your individual value proposition. This piece of evidence should place your individual value proposition firmly within the market you want it to hold value within.

Performance: Act on your value proposition by creating collateral to represent yourself to your target market.

Tag a piece of market-ready evidence that resulted from creating your self-brand.

small.title: Pitch: Your Solutions
small.Properties:
Empowerment: Define the value of your solution(s) to its target market.

This piece of evidence should differentiate your solution from others and offer a glimpse into the unique value proposition of your solution. Tag a piece of evidence that demonstrates that you have communicated the value of your solution to your intended market.

Wellness: Frame how the value of your solution(s) fits the need of the target market.

Tag a piece of evidence that provides the context for understanding the worth the target market gets from your solution’s value proposition. This piece of evidence should place your solution’s value proposition firmly within the market you want it to hold value within.

Performance: Act on the value of your solution executing it for the target market.

Tag a piece of market-ready evidence that resulted from executing your solution for the target market.

title: Submitting Your I Am Market-Ready Page for Instructor Assessment
Properties:
Submitting your I Am Market-Ready page for instructor assessment is a process. You should feel confident in taking your time to create this page. Through your journals, you are tracking your development so use your growing self-awareness to have an honest conversation with yourself in determining whether you have a page that will meet the expectations for success. In the top right-hand corner of your I Am Market-Ready page, you will see a button titled Submit to Instructor. When you have gathered all of your content and tagged each of the Empowerment, Wellness, and Performance categories, you are ready to submit.

Once you have submitted to your instructor, they will evaluate your page according to the guidelines for each category. For each tag, they will determine if you have succeeded or failed at demonstrating the specific form of empowerment, wellness, or performance. If you have succeeded, the tag will be marked “S” and if you still have development you need to experience, the tag will be marked “F.” Your instructor will provide feedback for any tag marked “F” so you have support as you plan on how to continue to grow in this area. As you know from the program, feedback is an essential tool in becoming market-ready. Take it as data and learn from it. Set a new goal for yourself so you feel confident in your next submission.

title: Submitting Your I Am Market-Ready Page for Certification
Properties:
Submitting Your I Am Market-Ready Page for certification means you have accomplished a completely successful submission to your instructor who has marked each of your empowerment, wellness, and performance tags with an “S.”

When you have met this requirement, you can go back to the top right-hand corner of your I Am Market-Ready Page and click the button titled “Submit for Certification.” The Startup Studio will evaluate your Performance tags and similar to your instructor evaluation will mark each tag with “S” or “F” and provide feedback in any cases where a tag is marked with an “F.”

Remember, unlike submitting to your instructor, submitting for certification after receiving any “F” tags and feedback will have a time restriction. If you do not succeed in your submission, you will have to wait six months before you will be allowed to submit again. This time period is set to ensure you have taken the feedback seriously and have done the work to be ready for submission.
